snippet: Many millennials have fallen so far behind that recovering lost ground could be impossible.
abstract: Editorial warns that economic recovery heralded by the Federal Reserve and others has mostly benefited those at the top of the income ladder; argues that millennials have fallen so far behind that recovering lost ground could be impossible, resulting in lopsided growth; calls on federal government to deploy more resources to head off this huge waste of human capital.
lead_paragraph: Many millennials have fallen so far behind that recovering lost ground could be impossible.
